sub_title: General Manager Operations | CBRNe Specialist | 25+ years of expertise in disarmament inspections, investigations, training, and CBRN decontamination and detection
summary:
I am a CBRNe professional with 25+ years of experience in a laboratory and field working with toxic, radioactive, and hazardous materials in military, civilian, and OPCW & UN environments.

Previous and current employment allowed me to work closely with teams of diverse scientists, OPCW and UN Team Leaders, Inspectors, and colleagues from several national Emergency Management Agencies. I'm also adept at leading cross-functional teams and managing people from different cultural and professional backgrounds. 

My core competencies include: 

☣️   CBRN Defence & Decontamination
☣️   First Responders Training in Toxic or Contaminated Environment
☣️   Chemical Weapons Protection
☣️   Chemical and Radiological Disaster and Incident Assessment
☣️   Alleged Chemical Weapons Use Investigation - Including Non-permissive and/or Contaminated Environment
☣️   Strategic CBRN Protection Consulting
☣️   CBRNe Live Agent Training (LAT) and Simulant Agent Training (SAT) 
☣️   Risk Management
☣️   Emergency Management
☣️   Non-destructive Testing (NDT)
 
Based on my research and practical experience, I published more than 30 articles in high-impact scientific journals of physics, chemistry, non-destructive testing (NDT), emergency response management, and product development.

Looking forward to connecting with you!

treasury_media.title: A Fresh Approach: Review of the Production Development of the CBRN/HAZMAT Equipment
treasury_media.description:
Paper is describing basic postulates of product development of CBRN/HAZMAT equipment, current status in development protocols of the different equipment with recognized reviews, with emphasis on how much feedback of end-user appears to have been used in finalization of the product for serial/commercial production.

Link: https://www.springerprofessional.de/en/a-fresh-approach-review-of-the-production-development-of-the-cbr/15180382

profile_positions.description:
• Lead the HZS operations including: training, testing and consultancy related deployments
• Equipment and assets oversight, as well as lead/support in recruiting, hiring and training of personnel 
 * Management of personnel deployments/activities
 * Workplace Health and Safety 
 * Organisational Policy and Procedures 
 * QIP and Continuous improvement plans 
•  Lead training related to operational and response aspects of CBRN readiness
•  Lead/support the CBRN equipment technical and operational development and/or trials 
•  Provide support in NDT (Non-Destructive Testing) equipment technical and operational certification, development and/or trials
profile_positions.title: General Manager, Operations (CBRNe SME)

company.name: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.title: Inspector (Chemical Weapons/Munitions Specialist), Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
- General management of HZS operations including: training, testing & consultancy related deployments.  
- Equipment and assets oversight, as well as lead/support in recruiting, hiring and training of personnel 
         * Management of personnel deployments/activities
         * Workplace Health and Safety	 
         * Organisational Policy and Procedures 
         * QIP and Continuous improvement plans 
- Leading training related to operational and response aspects of CBRN readiness
- Lead/Support in CBRN equipment technical and operational development and/or trials 
- Support in NDT (Non-Destructive Testing) equipment technical and operational certification, development and/or trials.
profile_positions.title: General Manager Operations

profile_positions.description:
- Overseeing all ongoing & approved projects related to the growing scope of company's CBRNe products (development either internally or in partnership with other companies).
- Timely coordination between product development leaders, other support functions in the product/project development (procurement, finance, administration, etc.), and the company's decision makers (COO and CEO).
- Still active in:
* Support and/or delivery of training related to operational and response aspects of CBRN readiness
* Support/Lead in CBRN equipment technical and operational development and/or trials 
* Support in NDT (Non-Destructive Testing) equipment technical and operational certification, development and/or trials.
profile_positions.title: Product Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Managing, coordination, support and/or delivery of training and projects related to operational and response aspects of CBRN readiness
- Support in CBRN equipment technical and operational development and/or trials 
- Support in NDT (Non-Destructive Testing) equipment technical and operational certification, development and/or trials.
profile_positions.title: CBRN SME (System Integration / Capital Projects Manager)

company.name: Technical Secretariat of the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
- As Head of Demilitarization Inspections within the OPCW Inspectorate Division, responsible for coordinating all inspections related to chemical disarmament.
- Still leading inspection teams on missions for verification of destruction of chemical weapons around the world.  
- Also deploying/leading on critical missions (involved in the investigation of the use of chemical weapons in Syria in August 2013, performed duties of Head of Field Ops within OPCW-UN Mission in Syria, Feb-March 2014).
profile_positions.title: Team Leader / Head of Demilitarisation Inspections (Chemical Weapons/Munition Specialist)

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
- Performing 
   1.Planning inspection; 
   2.Conducting & Leading Inspections; 
   3.Reporting Inspection; and 
   4.Other additional duties within or outside regular inspection activities in OPCW (NDE and  Radiation protection training, IAU/CI and Computers skills training) 
- Instructor in OPCW Inspectorate Training Cell, training of newly recruited OPCW Inspectors
- Radiation Protection Supervisor of the OPCW.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader / OPCW Inspector - Instructor (Chemical Weapons / Munition Specialist)

profile_positions.description:
Head of Section for Chemical Decontamination and Detection Phenomena, Department for Chemical Protection
- Coordination of researchers in developing and adopting of new analytical methods used in testing of decontamination, detection and protective equipment.
- Training of personnel in toxic chemicals and CWC related chemicals (schedule 1) manipulation and use of decontamination, detection and protective equipment.
- Head of research team investigating: decontamination efficiency of apparatus and chemicals in laboratory and field conditions, paint and other materials resistance on toxic chemicals, development of new decontamination substances and mixtures.
- Member of National Authority of Serbia and Montenegro and of escort team for OPCW inspection and a participant in preparing of annual declarations.
profile_positions.title: Head Of Section

profile_positions.description:
Department for Chemical Decontamination and Detection Phenomena
- Working in the area of research of kinetics and mechanisms of decontamination reactions between CWC related chemicals and new developed decontamination mixtures. Improving knowledge in techniques and methods of chemical analysis, such as electrochemical, GC, GC/MS and UV/and IR spectrometric techniques and methods.
- Researching on the field of chemical protection - development of new decontamination and detection equipment.
- Member of a team for destruction of toxic chemicals.
- Assisting National Authority in the implementation of Chemical Weapon Convention and team member for escorting of OPCW inspections.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

company.name: Ministry of Defence of the Republic of Serbia

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Defence of the Republic of Serbia
profile_positions.description:
Platoon Commander of NBC Defence Platoon for Decontamination
- Training of teams of active soldiers (conscripts) and of reserve troops for preparing, organizing and performing nuclear, chemical and biological decontamination, detection and protection. 
- Improving of experience in commanding and organization of field training.
- Commander of Squad for Removal of Chemical and Radiological Accidents Consequences for city of Belgrade.
- Performed additional duty of Environmental and working safety officer.
profile_positions.title: Platoon Commander
